text:
try to stop the webserver and we are getting 'INFO: unregistering logger 
Catalina:type=Logger' msg at the end of the process. The web server seems to 
be stopped but the process is still shown in the background. We are to use 
the 'kill' command to remove the process.  

Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService stop
INFO: Stopping service Catalina
Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol destroy
INFO: Stoping http11 protocol on 11620 Catalina:type=ThreadPool,name=http11620
Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer remove
INFO: Removing web application at context path /webdav
Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer remove
INFO: Removing web application at context path /servlets-examples
Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer remove
INFO: Removing web application at context path /jsp-examples
Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer remove
INFO: Removing web application at context path /balancer
Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer remove
INFO: Removing web application at context path /tomcat-docs
Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer remove
INFO: Removing web application at context path /ttfj
Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer remove
INFO: Removing web application at context path 
Nov 5, 2004 10:34:45 AM org.apache.catalina.logger.LoggerBase stop
INFO: unregistering logger Catalina:type=Logger
creator: chuib@adpomr.com
yoavs@computer.org
text:
This is most likely because your app or libraries use by it are spawning non-
daemon threads and aren't terminating those properly.  In those cases Tomcat is 
done and shuts down, but the JVM process cannot exit.  This has been discussed 
numerous times on the tomcat-user mailing list, and is not a Tomcat bug.  If 
you'd like further details, I suggest searching the tomcat-user mailing list 
archives and/or subscribing to the list to post your problem.  The logger 
removal and other messages in your log are normal and expected, not a problem 
nor relevant to your problem.
